    "body": "<!--\nIMPORTANT: Please fill out this template fully! Failure to do so will result in the issue being closed automatically.\n\nThis issue tracker is for bugs and feature requests in the RStudio IDE. If you're having trouble with R itself or an R package, see https://www.r-project.org/help.html, and if you want to ask a question rather than report a bug, go to https://forum.posit.co/. Finally, if you use RStudio Server Pro, get in touch with Posit Support at support@posit.co.\n\n-->\n\n### System details\n\n    RStudio Edition : <!-- Desktop or Server --> Desktop\n    RStudio Version : 2024.12.1+563 (2024.12.1+563)\n    OS Version      : Sequoia 15.3.2 (24D81)\n    R Version       : 4.4.1 (2024-06-14)\n\n### Steps to reproduce the problem\n\n### Describe the problem in detail\n\nI’m subscribed to GitHub Copilot Pro and authenticated successfully in RStudio (latest version 2023.12). I followed the instructions on Posti R Studio's page exactly and each time I get a successful message that I have linked R Studio with Copilot. However, in my Tools > Global Options > Copilot tab, R Studio says that says that I haven’t activated Copilot. On GitHub’s Copilot setup page, it says “Your GitHub Copilot setup is incomplete,” even though I’ve selected preferences multiple times.\n\nI’ve confirmed I’m not using a VPN, and I’m in a supported region. \n\nI’ve tried:\nReinstalling RStudio\nSigning out/in from RStudio Copilot\nClearing RStudio Copilot cache\nActivating Copilot from GitHub\nReauthenticating multiple times\n\nI contacte GitHub Copilot support and they replied that \"GitHub Copilot does not currently support RStudio as an IDE, which is why you're encountering issues with activation. While you may have successfully authenticated, the lack of official support for RStudio means that GitHub Copilot cannot function properly in this environment.\n\nTo use GitHub Copilot, you would need to switch to a supported IDE. For example, Visual Studio Code is a popular choice that supports R through extensions and integrates seamlessly with GitHub Copilot. You can find the full list of supported IDEs and setup instructions here: [Installing the GitHub Copilot extension in your environment](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/managing-copilot/configure-personal-settings/installing-the-github-copilot-extension-in-your-environment).\"\n\nFurther correspondence with GitHub Copilot Support they said, \"GitHub Copilot does not officially support RStudio as an IDE. While there may be third-party workarounds or demonstrations of GitHub Copilot being used in RStudio, these are not officially documented or supported by GitHub. The official list of supported IDEs includes environments like Visual Studio Code, JetBrains IDEs, and others, but RStudio is not among them. If you’ve seen videos or resources suggesting otherwise, they may involve unofficial methods or integrations that are not guaranteed to work consistently. If GitHub Copilot functionality in RStudio becomes officially supported in the future, it will be documented on the [GitHub Copilot documentation page](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot).\"\n\nSo I signed up for GitHub Copilot specifically to integrate with R Studio and R Studio advertises this feature, but according to GitHub it is not a supported feature and will not work.\n\n### Describe the behavior you expected\nI expected Copilot to work in R Studio as your web resources claim that it will.\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!-- \nPlease keep the below portion in your issue, and check `[x]` the applicable boxes.\n-->\n\n- [ X] I have read the guide for [submitting good bug reports](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Writing-Good-Bug-Reports).\n- [ X] I have installed the latest version of RStudio, and confirmed that the issue still persists.\n- [ X] If I am reporting an RStudio crash, I have included a [diagnostics report](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/200321257-Running-a-Diagnostics-Report).\n- [ X] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue.\n",

    "body": "### Problem Statement\n\nPer the [copilot sdk docs](https://github.com/github/copilot-language-server-release?tab=readme-ov-file#messages):\n\n> The client may be sent [window/showMessageRequest](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#window_showMessage) requests. Support for these messages is essential as they are used for important notifications including account and billing.\n\n### Proposed Behaviour\n\nWe should show any messages received via this callback to the user.\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!--\n\nThanks for taking the time to file a feature request! Please take the time to search for an existing feature request, to avoid creating duplicate requests. If you find an existing feature request, please give it a thumbs-up reaction, as we'll use these reactions to help prioritize the implementation of these features in the future.\n\nIf the feature has not yet been filed, then please describe the feature you'd like to see become a part of RStudio. See:\n\nhttps://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Writing-Good-Feature-Requests\n\nfor a guide on how to write good feature requests.\n\n-->\n",

    "body": "### Problem Statement\n\nWithin qmd files in the latest version of RStudio (Windows 11), placing the cursor **before** a code chunk (e.g., before ```` ```{r} ````) and pressing `Ctrl + Enter` causes an error. The error message varies, but it typically includes on of the following:\n\nWhen running ctrl-enter from a line that is one line or further from a code chunk\n```\nError in -title : invalid argument to unary operator\n```\n\nWhen running ctrl-enter from the start of the code chunk\n```\n> ```{r}\nError: attempt to use zero-length variable name\n```\n\nIf I remember correctly, RStudio previously incremented the cursor position until after the next valid code chunk and then execute that chunk. The current behavior, where it throws an error and increments one line is unexpected and unintuitive, resulting in a poor user experience.\n\n**System Details:**  \n- **Version:** RStudio 2024.12.1 Build 563  \n- **Release:** \"Kousa Dogwood\" (27771613, 2025-02-02)  \n- **OS:** Windows 11  \n- **Browser Info:**  \n  ```\n  Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko)  \n  RStudio/2024.12.1+563 Chrome/126.0.6478.234 Electron/31.7.7 Safari/537.36  \n  Quarto 1.5.57  \n  ```\n\n### Proposed Behaviour\n\nRStudio should handle `Ctrl + Enter` behavior consistently and intuitively. Specifically:  \n1. If the cursor is **outside** a code chunk, pressing `Ctrl + Enter` should attempt to execute the next valid code chunk\n2. If this is for some reason technically infeasible, if running code from an invalid location, a **clear and helpful message** (instead of a cryptic error) could improve UX.\n\n### QA Notes\n\n- Test `Ctrl + Enter` behavior in various cursor positions, including:  \n  - One line before a code chunk \n  - Right before a code chunk, on the same line as (` ```{r} `) \n  - Inside a code chunk  \n  - Inside a chunk but before any actual code  \n- Ensure that executing code via the **\"Run\" button** still works correctly.  \n- Check whether this issue occurs in both **.Rmd** and **.qmd** files.  \n- Confirm behavior consistency across operating systems.  \n\nThis change would improve usability and prevent unnecessary user confusion.\n",

    "body": "### TODO\r\n\r\n- [ ] Add an option to enable / disable this behavior.\r\n- [x] Only enable this for R (>= 4.0.0); use default styling otherwise.\r\n\r\n### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/2574.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nInstead of coloring all output on stderr, we now explicitly catch errors and warnings via global calling handlers, and style those.     "body": "This old issue `https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/5638` was never solved but closed.  Can someone look at this?\n\n> [mik3y64](https://github.com/mik3y64)\n> opened [on Oct 25, 2019](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/5638#issue-512789711) · edited by [mik3y64](https://github.com/mik3y64)\n> I use document outlines in both R and RMD scripts all the time. Whenever I close and reopen any files, the document outline is gone, regardless of the previous states. My current solution is to manually toggle document outline with hotkey, and obviously that's not ideal for every single newly opened files and it becomes annoying because I use it all the time.\n> \n> Feature request: Please allow a global option for users to enable document outline on/off by default, including newly opened files.\n> \n> Thank you for creating the best IDE for R.\n> ",

    "active_lock_reason": null,
    "body": "### Problem Statement\n\nThe `copilot-language-server` docs recommend using \"workspace folders\":\n\n> Workspace folders are optional but highly recommended as they greatly improve the quality of suggestions. See the LSP spec for [workspace/didChangeWorkspaceFolders](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#workspace_didChangeWorkspaceFolders).\n\nMore info: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@github/copilot-language-server\n\nWe don't currently leverage this (it may not have been present in the older copilot agent we used to use).\n\n### Proposed Behaviour\n\nThe docs are vague (at best) about what greatness and joy is accomplished by using this, but it seems like we could be providing the project folder as the \"workspace folder\" when a project is open in RStudio.\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!--\n\nThanks for taking the time to file a feature request! Please take the time to search for an existing feature request, to avoid creating duplicate requests. If you find an existing feature request, please give it a thumbs-up reaction, as we'll use these reactions to help prioritize the implementation of these features in the future.\n\nIf the feature has not yet been filed, then please describe the feature you'd like to see become a part of RStudio. See:\n\nhttps://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Writing-Good-Feature-Requests\n\nfor a guide on how to write good feature requests.\n\n-->\n",

    "body": "###  In this particular case, \"control+enter\" is unable to identify the context (block to execute)\n\nWhen trying to execute this function with \"control+enter\", it's not able to identify all the content of the function\n```r\njust_a_function <- function() {\n  example_string <- \"\nxxx {\n}\n\"\n  print(example_string)\n}\njust_a_function()\n```\n\n\nPlacing the cursor in the first line\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55e2e2d4-fee0-4bda-b6a2-4a92efc62696)\nand the pressing \"control+enter\"\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d323a054-1cd7-4388-8c45-6d3d73a19bc8)\nthe console shows \"+\" (it's waiting for the rest of the text to execute).\n\n\n\n### Proposed Behaviour\nIf all the lines are selected, the execution is correct.\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0f559ea5-453c-4cf6-8b36-622a76cec26b)\n\nI would like to ask to improve the detection of the context around the line the cursor is placed in.\n",

    "body": "<!--\nIMPORTANT: Please fill out this template fully! Failure to do so will result in the issue being closed automatically.\n\nThis issue tracker is for bugs and feature requests in the RStudio IDE. If you're having trouble with R itself or an R package, see https://www.r-project.org/help.html, and if you want to ask a question rather than report a bug, go to https://forum.posit.co/. Finally, if you use RStudio Server Pro, get in touch with Posit Support at support@posit.co.\n\n-->\n\n### System details\n\n    RStudio Edition : Desktop\n    RStudio Version : 2024.12.1+563\n    OS Version      : Windows-11 24H2\n    R Version       : 4.4.2\n\n### Steps to reproduce the problem\n\n- install the latest `devtools` package if not already installed\n- create a new package project (File / New Project / New Directory / R Package) with default settings\n- click \"Check\" in the Build Tab (or run `devtools::check(document = FALSE)` in the Console)\n- examine the output\n\n### Describe the problem in detail\n\n```\n   ERROR: Unknown command \"TMPDIR=C:/Users/tomto/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmpw7JSnM/file529c14046755\". Did you mean command \"install\"?\n   Warning message:\n   In system2(\"quarto\", \"-V\", stdout = TRUE, env = paste0(\"TMPDIR=\",  :\n     running command '\"quarto\" TMPDIR=C:/Users/tomto/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmpw7JSnM/file529c14046755 -V' had status 1\n```\n\n### Describe the behavior you expected\n\nNo error.\n\nThis is an invalid invocation of Quarto; seems to be trying to set an environment variable via a Linux/Mac technique (`$ TMPDIR=FOO quarto`) but that isn't a valid approach on Windows.\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!-- \nPlease keep the below portion in your issue, and check `[x]` the applicable boxes.\n-->\n\n- [x] I have read the guide for [submitting good bug reports](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Writing-Good-Bug-Reports).\n- [x] I have installed the latest version of RStudio, and confirmed that the issue still persists.\n- [x] If I am reporting an RStudio crash, I have included a [diagnostics report](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/200321257-Running-a-Diagnostics-Report).\n- [x] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue.\n",

    "body": "### System details\n\n    RStudio Edition : Desktop\n    RStudio Version : 2024.12.1+563\n    OS Version      : Windows-11 Pro 24H2\n    R Version       : 4.4.2\n\n### Steps to reproduce the problem\n\n- RTools not installed (required for this scenario)\n- Tools / Global Options / Packages: click \"Change...\" and set primary repository to `https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/latest`\n- File / New Project / New Directory / R Package\n- Give it a name and create the project\n- On the Build tab, click \"Check\"\n- Eventually get a dialog saying \"Building R packages requires installation of additional build tools\"; click \"Yes\"\n\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d143a9fd-e9a8-4f49-97a0-fa36d0393288)\n\n### Describe the problem in detail\n\n- Errors in the console (RTools fails to download):\n\n```\ntrying URL 'https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44'\nError in utils:::download.file(url = \"https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44\",  : \n  cannot open URL 'https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44'\nIn addition: Warning messages:\n1: In download.file(url, destfile, mode = \"wb\", quiet = TRUE) :\n  cannot open URL 'https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/latest/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools44/rtools.html': HTTP status was '404 Not Found'\n2: In utils:::download.file(url = \"https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44\",  :\n  cannot open URL 'https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44': HTTP status was '404 Not Found'\nError in utils:::download.file(url = \"https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44\",  : \n  cannot open URL 'https://rstudio.org/links/rtools44'\n```\n\n### Describe the behavior you expected\n\n- RTools downloads and installation is triggered\n- This works if using the default settings for the primary package repository, downloading from `https://cran.rstudio.com/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools44/files/rtools44-6459-6401.exe`\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!-- \nPlease keep the below portion in your issue, and check `[x]` the applicable boxes.\n-->\n\n- [x] I issue still persists.\n- [x] If I am reporting an RStudio crash, I have included a [diagnostics report](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/200321257-Running-a-Diagnostics-Report).\n- [x] I Finally, if you use RStudio Server Pro, get in touch with Posit Support at support@posit.co.\n\n-->\n\n### System details\n\n    RStudio Edition : Desktop\n    RStudio Version : 2024.12.1+563 (2024.12.1+563)\n    OS Version      : MacOS Sequoia 15.3.1\n    R Version       : 4.4.3\n\n### Steps to reproduce the problem\n\nCreate a new Rstudio project\nThen, with the project open\n\n```\nmydata <- matrix(rnorm(10000), ncol=100)\nsaveRDS(mydata, \"test.R\")\n```\n\nRstudio will crash with \"encountered fatal error\".  \n\n### Describe the problem in detail\n\nIf a project directory has a binary file with a \".R\" extension Rstudio will crash when trying to open that project, or when the faulty .R file is created.  This is a new behavior.  I assume that Rstudio is recursively going through the directory tree and reading all \".R\" files but fails to check whether they are text files before trying.\n\n### Describe the behavior you expected\n\nRstudio to open without crashing.     "body": "<!--\nIMPORTANT: Please fill out this template fully! Failure to do so will result in the issue being closed automatically.\n\nThis issue tracker is for bugs and feature requests in the RStudio IDE. If you're having trouble with R itself or an R package, see https://www.r-project.org/help.html, and if you want to ask a question rather than report a bug, go to https://forum.posit.co/. Finally, if you use RStudio Server Pro, get in touch with Posit Support at support@posit.co.\n\n-->\n\n### System details\n\n    RStudio Edition : <!-- Desktop or Server --> Desktop\n    RStudio Version : 2024.12.0 Build 467\n    OS Version      :  Windows 11\n    R Version       : R version 4.4.1 (2024-06-14 ucrt) \n\n### Steps to reproduce the problem\nAny Rmd file that has an extra newline in an inline r code before the left curly bracket will get corrupted when you switch to visual mode.  EXAMPLE::  (i've attached a CSV file that actually has a breaking Rmd code in it for example so you can see)\n\n## Normal Text Content\n\nThis is a demonstration of a bug in the RStudio Visual Editor.\n\n### Bug Example 1: Extra Newline Before Opening Brace (WILL BREAK)\n\nThe code below has an extra newline before the opening brace. This will break when switching to Visual mode and back:\n\n```\n`r if (TRUE)\n  \n{ \"testing has extra newline before LEFT curly bracket\"} `\n```\n\n\n### Describe the problem in detail\nif you have in-line R code and leave an extra newline before the left curly brace and then switch to visual mode this will get corrupted and changed to escape the r section with backslashes.  so the beginning backtick gets escaped with a backslash by switching into visual mode and this then breaks things.\n\nso, just in case my example above gets corrupted in-line here...  just put into an Rmd file the following characters.   I'm using quote marks around each character you should type:\n\"backtick\" then \"r\" then \"if (TRUE)\" then \"newline\" then another \"newline\" then \"{testing 123}\"  then end with another \"backtick\"...    the key point is that between that inside the inline r code there is an extra newline before the left curly brace.  :\n\n\n\n### Describe the behavior you expected\nIt should parse the same no matter if there is zero or 1 or 2 or whatever newlines\n\n### QA Notes\n\n> Once you have opened a PR, add additional information for QA on how to validate the change, paying special attention to the level of risk, adjacent areas that could be affected by the change, and any important contextual information not present in the original description.\n\n<!-- \nPlease keep the below portion in your issue, and check `[x]` the applicable boxes.\n-->\n\n- [ x] I have read the guide for [submitting good bug reports](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Writing-Good-Bug-Reports).\n- [ x] I have installed the latest version of RStudio, and confirmed that the issue still persists.\n- [ ] If I am reporting an RStudio crash, I have included a [diagnostics report](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/200321257-Running-a-Diagnostics-Report).\n- [x\n\n[BugReportNewline.csv](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19322869/BugReportNewline.csv)\n\n ] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue.\n",

    "active_lock_reason": null,
    "body": "\nWhen importing a text file via **File -> Import Datasaet -> From Text (readr)** and then using the dropdown menu in the Data Preview to change the data type of a column, and then choosing **Factor**, a box appears stating: „Please insert a comma-separated list of factors“\nI think this is incorrect: It should say „Please insert a comma-separated list of **factor levels**“  (because the factor levels and their order need to be specified, not factors itself)\n\n<img width=\"350\" alt=\"Image\" src=\"https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8dd47743-d199-4879-b85b-3440ab7d1ba7\" />",
    "closed_by": null,

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nThe copilot-language-server was not being found when running a dev build (desktop or server) on macOS (and presumably also on Linux).\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nGet rid of reference to `COPILOT_ENABLED`; I had removed that but missed an instance.\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nNA\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nDev environment only.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nNA\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n\r\n<!-- Note for community contributors: Please sign our contributor agreement as described in CONTRIBUTING.md and note that you've done so in this space.     "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nKeep the powershell script for bootstrapping an RStudio dev machine on WIndows in sync with recent Dockerfile changes.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nInstall same version of Windows SDK and also add strawberryperl (required for building some dependencies).\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nTested via building\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nNA\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nNA\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n\r\n<!-- Note for community contributors: Please sign our contributor agreement as described in CONTRIBUTING.md and note that you've done so in this space.     "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nBundle latest release of `copilot-language-server` (1.287.0).\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nUpdated copilot version constants.     "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nUpdate to latest release of copilot-language-server (https://github.com/github/copilot-language-server-release).\r\n\r\nSee also https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio-pro/issues/7450.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nUploaded new 1.284.0 bits to S3 bucket, updated constants.\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nRan some local sanity tests with Mac Desktop and Mac Dev Server.\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nTest via general copilot usage.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nNA\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n\r\n<!-- Note for community contributors: Please sign our contributor agreement as described in CONTRIBUTING.md and note that you've done so in this space. Very much appreciate your contributions and support! -->\r\n\r\n\r\n",

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15734.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nIf a formatter has been configured, and the document is configured to auto-format on save, then always allow the save command to run (since we don't know if the format-before-save action might mutate a \"clean\" document).\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nTest via notes in https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15734.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n",

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses #4037.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nMostly straightforward use of the HTML 5 drag and drop API.   {
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/rstudio/rstudio/pulls/15783",
    "id": 2386416968,
    "node_id": "PR_kwDOABGCR86OPdVI",
    "html_url": "https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/pull/15783",
    "diff_url": "https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/pull/15783.diff",
    "patch_url": "https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/pull/15783.patch",
    "issue_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15783",
    "number": 15783,
    "state": "closed",
    "locked": false,
    "title": "Use Copilot Language Server SDK for Copilot integration",
    "user": {
      "login": "gtritchie",
      "id": 10569626,
      "node_id": "MDQ6VXNlcjEwNTY5NjI2",
      "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/10569626?v=4",
      "gravatar_id": "",
      "url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie",
      "html_url": "https://github.com/gtritchie",
      "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/followers",
      "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/following{/other_user}",
      "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/gists{/gist_id}",
      "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
      "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/subscriptions",
      "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/orgs",
      "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/repos",
      "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/events{/privacy}",
      "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/gtritchie/received_events",
      "type": "User",
      "user_view_type": "public",
      "site_admin": false
    },
    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio-pro/issues/7450.\r\n\r\nAlso deals with: https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15610, https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15714, https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/14156, https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/14844\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\n> [!NOTE]\r\n> The `copilot-language-server` was already added to the project (and installed with RStudio) via: https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/pull/15769.\r\n\r\n#### Copilot Language Server\r\n\r\nThe [Copilot Language Server](https://github.com/github/copilot-language-server-release) provides standalone binary executables which are launched directly instead of requiring a separate node.js installation.\r\n\r\n- `copilot-language-server` for Linux (separate ones for x64 and aarch64) and Mac (arm64)\r\n- `copilot-language-server-x64` for Mac (x64)\r\n- `copilot-language-server.exe` for Windows (x64)\r\n\r\nRStudio's Mac Desktop / Desktop Pro is a Universal app, so includes both the arm64 and x64 versions.\r\n\r\nOther platforms include only the one matching the package's target architecture.\r\n\r\nYou can confirm the version of the Copilot Language Server either via the Copilot Diagnostics dialog in RStudio (accessed from the Copilot options pane), or by running from a terminal `copilot-language-server --version`.\r\n\r\n<img width=\"619\" alt=\"copilot-diag\" src=\"https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a682c68-14e4-4bd9-94d0-cd7a1b684ccc\" />\r\n\r\n#### Removing node.js\r\n\r\nThis PR stops installing node.js via the dependency scripts, and no longer includes it in the installation packages. Note that Workbench (commercial product) ships its own separate copy of node.js used for other purposes, but open-source does not.\r\n\r\nWe still install node.js for use at build-time, but that version doesn't get included in the distribution packages for RStudio/Workbench.\r\n\r\n#### Removing Agent Download\r\n\r\nRStudio now bundles the copilot-language-server, so the UI and logic for downloading the \"copilot agent\" has been removed. So this dialog is no more:\r\n\r\n<img width=\"431\" alt=\"rstudio dialog shown when copilot agent is not installed\" src=\"https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95eac3f6-5748-4533-b0d8-586400ae8fc2\" />\r\n\r\n#### Environment Variable\r\n\r\nAn alternate location for the `copilot-language-server` can be specified by setting the environment variable `RSTUDIO_COPILOT_FOLDER` to point to a folder containing the `copilot-language-server` binaries. Only the path should be provided, the appropriate `copilot-language-server` variant will be added to the supplied path based on OS and architecture.\r\n\r\nThis is primarily a \"just in case\" mechanism and should rarely be needed. For Server/Workbench, the rsession.conf setting `external-copilot-path` can also be used to point to a custom location (see below).\r\n\r\n#### Session Options\r\n\r\nThe following session options are now deprecated:\r\n\r\n- `external-node-path`\r\n- `external-copilot-agent-path`\r\n- `copilot-agent-helper`\r\n\r\nThe following new options are used, instead:\r\n\r\n- `external-copilot-path` (instead of `external-copilot-agent-path`)\r\n- `copilot-helper` (instead of `copilot-agent-helper`)\r\n\r\nIf using the `copilot-helper` to have the language server launched indirectly via a custom script, the environment variable `RSTUDIO_COPILOT_PATH` will be set pointing to the language server binary (this was previously `RSTUDIO_COPILOT_AGENT_PATH`).\r\n\r\n#### Other Changes\r\n\r\n- update the copilot-language-server from 1.280.0 to 1.283.0\r\n- removed the \"Copilot: Install Agent\" command from RStudio\r\n- removed `twxs.cmake` from the VSCode recommended extensions (RStudio dev environment) as it is considered obsolete (hasn't been updated in 5+ years), see https://github.com/twxs/vs.language.cmake/issues/119\r\n- removed COPILOT_ENABLED cmake flag; I had added that earlier thinking I'd make it possible to build RStudio without any Copilot features at all, but I don't have time for that\r\n- adjust the Windows dependency installer to correctly update quarto dependency if the current version is different\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nNone added for this change.\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nFrom a user point of view, functionality should be the same as before. Only noticable difference will be the lack of needing to download and install the agent since we now bundle the replacement directly with RStudio. So we can close \r\n\r\nThe existing proxy-server support _should_ work as it did before, but I haven't done any direct testing of that yet.\r\n\r\nI don't have an Intel Mac, so please test Copilot on one (to make sure the code is correctly using the x64 version of the copilot-language-server).\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nNone\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n\r\n<!-- Note for community contributors: Please sign our contributor agreement as described in CONTRIBUTING.md and note that you've done so in this space. Very much appreciate your contributions and support! -->\r\n\r\n\r\n",

    "title": "use alternate message when restoring R",

      "login": "kevinushey",

      "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/kevinushey/following{/other_user}",
      "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/kevinushey/gists{/gist_id}",

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/14511.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\n- Use an alternate message when restoring R.\r\n- Try to be more careful about how we handle and dismiss serialization messages.\r\n- Try to be more careful in how we manage the suspend UI state.\r\n\r\nThis PR doesn't actually change anything around how suspend / resume is performed; it just changes how it's reported to the user. In particular, we now properly report \"Restoring R session...\" while the session is being restored, instead of \"Backing up R session...\", which surely caused some confusion.\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nTest via notes in https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/14511.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n",

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15777.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nTweak how we detect incomplete CSR escapes. In particular:\r\n\r\n- Check for single `\\033` escapes up-front, and buffer those.\r\n- Parse SGR escapes as just a special case of a CSI escape.\r\n- Check for an incomplete CSI escape before ANSI escapes, and continue parsing those.\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nTests included.\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nTest via notes in https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/15777.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n",

    "body": "### Intent\r\n\r\nAddresses part of https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/issues/13427.\r\n\r\n### Approach\r\n\r\nExtend the existing Copilot integration to visual editor code chunks; mostly by checking for visual mode + an active visual editor in the TextEditingTargetCopilotHelper, and doing some magic to compute the equivalent source editor cursor position when requesting Copilot completions.\r\n\r\n### Automated Tests\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### QA Notes\r\n\r\nTest that Copilot completions are offered within R code chunks of the visual editor.\r\n\r\n### Documentation\r\n\r\nN/A\r\n\r\n### Checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] If this PR adds a new feature, or fixes a bug in a previously released version, it includes an entry in `NEWS.md`\r\n- [x] If this PR adds or changes UI, the updated UI meets [accessibility standards](https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio/wiki/Accessibility)\r\n- [x] A reviewer is assigned to this PR (if unsure who to assign, check Area Owners list)\r\n- [x] This PR passes all local unit tests\r\n",

    "body": "Agree we need to do something here. The basic heuristic I use is this: wherever an error return happens we either need to:\n\n(a) explicitly code around it (e.g. we expected it)\n\n(b) log it -- you do this using the LOG_ERROR(error) construct\n\n(c) return it to the caller\n\nFor situations where it is highly unlikely that an error will occur AND where the client code can recover gracefully I'll tend to eat the error and log it. For example, when writing a user preference back to a settings file errors are swallowed and logged -- if this happens we of course need to know about it (via the logs) but its not worth complicating all of the client code with error handling when there will almost never be an error.\n\nIn this case I'd say you should either log the error and return true (so the client isn't bothered by it) or change the signature to Error checkSpelling(const std::string& word, bool *pCorrect) and return the value in the pointer. For a low level API I'd lean towards the latter as it will let the caller decide how \"mission critical\" the checking of the word actually is.\n",

Example user.dic:\n+   // ----------\n+   // 3\n+   // lol/S\n+   // rofl/S\n+   // tl;dr/S\n+   // ----------\n+   // The '/S' modifier treats 'ROFL','rofl', and 'Rofl' as correct spellings.\n+   Error addDictionary(const FilePath& dicPath, const std::string& key, bool *pAdded)\n+   {\n+      if (!dicPath.exists())\n+         return core::fileNotFoundError(dicPath, ERROR_LOCATION);\n+      *pAdded = (pHunspell_->add_dic(dicPath.absolutePath().c_str(),key.c_str()) == 0);",

    "body": "One (much too) subtle convention we have is to convert UTF-8 encoded file paths to system-encoded file paths before sending them to external apis. So here you would derive the path to pass to add_dic as follows:\n\nstd::string systemDicPath = string_utils::utf8ToSystem(dicPath.absolutePath());\n\nThis mostly works around situations where the system encoding is not UTF-8 (Windows) and there are special unicode characters in the path (e.g .characters with accents).\n",
